snippet: Mr. Laris Cohen’s Company Gallery performance-exhibition is the re-creation of Isamu Noguchi’s set for the Martha Graham dance “Embattled Garden.”
abstract: Visual artist and choreographer Yve Laris Cohen blurs boundaries between wage labor and art making in exhibit Embattled Garden, which features reconstruction of Isamu Naguchi's set for Martha Graham 1958 dance of same title, at Company Gallery on Lower East Side; set is both art object and designed to be used in performance by Martha Graham Dance Company.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Laris Cohen’s Company Gallery performance-exhibition is the re-creation of Isamu Noguchi’s set for the Martha Graham dance “Embattled Garden.”

headline.main: Yve Laris Cohen, Melding Identities as Laborer and Artist
headline.print_headline: The $15-an-Hour Laborer Over There Was in the Whitney Biennial
